title: 110_hr1562
content: The "Katrina Housing Tax Relief Act of 2007" extends and expands low-income housing credit rules for buildings in the GO Zones. The "Katrina Housing Tax Relief Act of 2007" extends low-income housing credit rules for buildings in the Gulf Opportunity Zone, Rita GO Zone, and Wilma GO Zone until 2011. It also extends the period for treating GO Zones as Difficult Development Areas. The "Katrina Housing Tax Relief Act of 2007" extends low-income housing credit rules for buildings in designated zones until 2011. It also adjusts the period for determining if buildings are federally subsidized. The "Katrina Housing Tax Relief Act of 2007" extends low-income housing credit rules for buildings in designated zones until 2011, excluding certain loans from being considered below market Federal loans. Special tax-exempt bond financing rule for repairs and reconstructions of residences in the GO Zones. Special tax-exempt bond financing rule for repairs and reconstructions of residences in the GO Zones includes a special rule for repairs and reconstructions due to hurricanes in designated zones. The special tax-exempt bond financing rule applies to repairs or reconstructions of residences in designated zones, with a requirement that expenditures for repair or reconstruction must be 25 percent or more of the mortgagor's adjusted basis in the residence. This rule only applies to owner-financing provided after the enactment date and before January 1, 2011. GAO will study how state and local governments allocate and use tax incentives under the Gulf Opportunity Zone Act of 2005. The Comptroller General of the United States will conduct a study on the allocation and utilization of tax incentives by State and local governments under the Gulf Opportunity Zone Act of 2005. A report with recommendations will be submitted to relevant Congressional committees within one year of the enactment of this Act. If significant fraud, waste, or abuse is found, Congressional hearings will be held within 60 days. Within 60 days of the report submission, each Committee specified in subsection (b) will hold a public hearing to review findings on abuse. SEC. 5. Modification of collection due process procedures for employment tax liabilities. Modification of collection due process procedures for employment tax liabilities includes amendments to Section 6330 of the Internal Revenue Code regarding disqualified employment tax levy. This levy is defined as any levy related to the collection of employment taxes for a taxable period. The amendments to Section 6330 of the Internal Revenue Code modify collection due process procedures for employment tax liabilities, specifically addressing a disqualified employment tax levy. This levy pertains to unpaid employment taxes within the most recent 2-year period before the taxable period of the levy, and must be served before February 29, 2016. The effective date for these amendments is 120 days after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 6. TIME FOR PAYMENT OF CORPORATE ESTIMATED TAXES. Amendment made to section 401(1) of the Tax Increase Prevention and Reconciliation Act of 2005, changing the percentage from 106.25 to 106.45. Passed by the House of Representatives on March 27, 2007.
